locale.message: Export articles and issues for Portico Digital Preservation Service
Note that the password supplied here is stored in plaintext in the database.

This plugin may be used to export your journal content for inclusion in the Portico digital preservation service. Content maybe downloaded manually to your local computer for later delivery to Portico, or may be sent directly to your account on the Portico FTP server by using the "Configure FTP" option below prior to exporting issues.

This plugin may be used to export your journal content for inclusion in the Portico digital preservation service. Content maybe downloaded manually to your local computer for later delivery to Portico, or may be sent directly to your account on the Portico FTP server.
If you are not currently participating in the Portico preservation service and wish to sign an agreement to do so, contact publisher.relations@portico.org or see www.portico.org for more information.
After configuring your FTP credentials below, you can export data via the plugin's export page.

To export an individual issue, click either the "export" or "ftp transfer" link in the "Action" column for the issue you wish to deliver to Portico. Clicking "export" will allow you to download the file locally; clicking "ftp transfer" will kick off a deposit to the Portico FTP site (if previously configured in the plugin by you).

To export multiple issue at one time, click the box next to each issue you wish to include in the delivery, then click the "export" button that appears below the table.
If you have been provided with FTP access to Portico, you can use this plugin to transfer article content directly. Please add your username and password below.

Note: It appears that you have not configured an online ISSN for your journal. This is not strictly mandatory, but will simplify the deposit process. You may configure an ISSN from Journal Setup Step 1.1.

Note: It appears that you have not configured an abbreviation for your journal. This is not strictly mandatory, but will simplify the deposit process. You may create an abbreviation from Journal Setup Step 1.1.

The FTP export was not successful. Your server may have taken too long to send the file to the Portico FTP server, or your credentials may not be correct. Please check your credentials, and failing that, try manually downloading your articles to send via an external FTP client.
